preFooter.headline: Want to get in touch?
preFooter.content: If you have questions or just want to say hello, please do not hesitate to contact us!

qAndAs.question: What is ReDI Talent Pool?
qAndAs.answer: ReDI Talent Pool ls is a dedicated platform designed to empower our talents, enabling them to showcase their capabilities to our network of partner companies in Germany. ReDI talent pool serves as a platform for ReDI job seekers to showcase their skills, talents, and experiences to potential employers and opportunities within the digital sector.

qAndAs.question: How does it work?
qAndAs.answer: Through our talent pool, our ReDI talents gain access to a wide range of internship and job opportunities with our partner companies. We facilitate connecting with companies with real job openings and  internships, aiming to support our ReDI talents to gain practical experience and establish their foothold in the German job market.

qAndAs.question: How do I get started?
qAndAs.answer: To begin, just click the 'Sign-up now' button. Then, decide if you're a job seeker (all ReDI talents looking for a job) or a company representative.Finally, follow the steps to sign up. It's easy!

qAndAs.question: What should I do if I'm having technical issues?
qAndAs.answer: If you run into tech troubles, simply click the red 'Any tech issues?' button, located in the middle right of the page, to reach our technical support team. You can rate the platform and type out your question to get assistance, attach the screenshot and enter email address for giving us an opportunity to follow-up with you.

qAndAs.question: How should I proceed if I have a general question about the ReDI Talent Pool?
qAndAs.answer: Just click the 'Contact us' button, located at the bottom middle of the page. You can send us an email, and our Talent Pool managers will get back to you.

qAndAs.question: Who is eligible to join the talent pool?
qAndAs.answer: The talent pool is exclusively open to individuals who are learners with ReDI School of Digital Integration, and are located in Germany. This includes current learners who are actively enrolled in a ReDI course as well as past students (Alumni) who have completed their course.

qAndAs.question: Do I have to meet with someone from the Talent Success Team before I can start?
qAndAs.answer: You are not required to meet with anyone from the ReDI Career Support Team before getting started. Simply create a user account as a job seeker, log in, and begin building your profile. Once you've completed all the necessary fields and are ready, you can click the button to submit it for review.

qAndAs.question: How can I create a good profile as a Job Seeker?
qAndAs.answer: Our ReDI platform is designed to assist you in presenting your skills, experiences, and enthusiasm to make a positive impact. You will find step-by-step guidance to help you create a powerful and effective profile that stands out to potential employers.

qAndAs.question: Is it recommended to include a photo in my profile?
qAndAs.answer: Including a photo in your profile is a personal choice. Some users find that adding a photo helps others get to know them and can contribute to building trust. However, the decision is entirely up to you, and if you're more comfortable without a photo, that's absolutely fine. Choose what aligns with your preferences and makes you feel most at ease on the platform.

qAndAs.question: What is a CV Builder?
qAndAs.answer: The CV Builder is a special tool developed for ReDI talents. It lets you create and download your CV for job applications. Studies say recruiters only look at a CV for about 2 minutes the first time. That's why it's crucial to keep it concise, focusing on the key details and fitting it on one page. This helps make a great first impression and increases your chances of getting an interview invite.

qAndAs.question: How can I browse Companies?
qAndAs.answer: Select the 'Browse' option located in the left navigation bar, then begin exploring the job postings. Feel free to use filters to refine your search for more specific results.

qAndAs.question: Will there be additional companies joining the Talent Pool?
qAndAs.answer: Yes, we are actively engaging with numerous companies and expanding our network of partner companies featured in the Talent Pool.

qAndAs.question: Can I apply for a job through the platform?
qAndAs.answer: Currently, we don't have a direct job application feature on our platform. However, you can create your CV, download it, and then apply for a job using the contact information provided in the job posting.

qAndAs.question: Can I keep my profile private?
qAndAs.answer: Absolutely! Simply select the checkbox that says 'Hide my profile from companies' on your profile page. This way, your profile won't be visible to companies when they're looking for potential talents.

qAndAs.question: Can I make changes to my profile after it's been approved?
qAndAs.answer: Certainly! We encourage you to regularly update your profile with any new skills you acquire and projects you become involved in even after it has been approved. Keeping your profile current helps showcase your growth and achievements accurately.

qAndAs.question: Do I have to reach out to a ReDI contact before I can start?
qAndAs.answer: Yes, we advise you to reach out via partner@redi-school.org before getting started in order to avoid complications at a later point in time. We only admit ReDI community members into our ReDI Talent Pool to guarantee that the platform remains a safe space for all individuals on it.

qAndAs.question: How can I browse Job seekers?
qAndAs.answer: Select the 'Browse' option located in the left navigation bar and find the talent you're looking for. Feel free to use filters to refine your search for more specific results.

qAndAs.question: Can Jobseekers apply for a job through the platform?
qAndAs.answer: Currently, we don't have a direct job application feature on our platform. However, a jobseeker can create a CV, download it, and then apply for a job using the contact information that you provide in the job posting.

qAndAs.question: Can I keep my profile private?
qAndAs.answer: Absolutely! Simply select the checkbox that says 'Hide job listings from jobseekers' on your profile page. This way, job postings won't be visible to jobseekers when they're looking for a potential job.

qAndAs.question: How can I contact job seekers?
qAndAs.answer: You are free to contact job seekers by using any of the contact details provided. Usually, ReDI candidates add the relevant details through which they wish to be contacted.

qAndAs.question: If I want to hire a ReDI student, what do I need to be aware of?
qAndAs.answer: If you hire one of our students we kindly ask you to report this to us. We are a non-profit organization and our internal structures demand that we document all our activities. Therefore we also must know when and where our students find employment.

qAndAs.question: Do ReDI candidates need any additional support for their (job) integration?
qAndAs.answer: As an employer you are not expected to take over the responsibility to integrate ReDI candidates. It is only advisable that you allow a smooth integration into the new job, just like it is for every new employee. Some ReDI students do not have perfect German skills and are new to the German work culture, but all of them are willing to learn and will make an effort if you provide them with an opportunity. If you are open, welcoming and curious, we are sure that your new employee will be too.

qAndAs.question: Which kind of job seekers are looking for jobs on the ReDI Talent Pool?
qAndAs.answer: The ReDI Talent Pool is accessible to all ReDI job seekers and contains profiles from current and former ReDI students who have various skill-sets. The ReDI community consists of 104 different nationalities, over 60% identify themselves as female and more than 70% have obtained a university degree (on top of the ReDI certification). Yes - we are proud of our diversity!

qAndAs.question: Do ReDI job seekers have a specific professional background?
qAndAs.answer: The short answer is no. ReDI students come from different countries and have different backgrounds. Some ReDI students come to Germany with profound tech knowledge and many have already studied at the University in their home country, others have a different (academic) background and seek to start a career in the German tech industry. All ReDI students have one thing in common though: Their interest in tech and their strong motivation to start a new career in Germany.

qAndAs.question: Are there any requirements for accessing the ReDI Talent Pool as a company?
qAndAs.answer: The ReDI Talent Pool serves as a safe space for the ReDI Community and therefore it is also not open to everybody. To access the ReDI Talent Pool as a company representative your company must be a ReDI Career Partner. You should get in touch with our partnership team (partner@redi-school.org) in order to find out how to become a ReDI Career Partner.

qAndAs.question: Must I pay to post a job application on the ReDI Talent Pool?
qAndAs.answer: For our ReDI Career Partners, the usage of the ReDI Talent Pool does not carry additional fees. This means you can post as much as you want without any hidden costs.

qAndAs.question: Must I pay to hire ReDI candidates?
qAndAs.answer: We do not charge anything once you hire a ReDI candidate, quite on the contrary: We are stoked about every ReDI alumni who finds their way into the tech industry. What we ask for is that you notify us - Remember, we are a non-profit organization and we must document all our activities.

mentor.headline: How to become a mentor?
mentor.content: Putting two minds together is always more fun and interesting than coming up with something by yourself! That’s why we want to connect you as mentors with the students and alumni of our Digital Career Program. Share your experience, your network and your knowledge. In exchange, you will look at things from a different perspective or simply meet a great person!

mentee.headline: How to become a mentee?
mentee.content: With the mentorship program we connect our students and alumni of the Digital Career Programm with (IT) professionals from leading companies. As a student or “mentee” you get guidance, career advice and high level support with your personal and professional environment.

mentor.title: the mentor checklist
mentor.headline: Are you ready to become a mentor?
items: I work as a trained professional.
I can support people in their career development in the digital industry.
I am willing to  share knowledge and experiences with others.
I am open to meet other nationalities.
I have the time to meet mentees during my free time.
I have time to support on a personal and professional level.

mentee.title: the mentee checklist
mentee.headline: Are you ready to become a mentee?
items: I am a student or student alumni at ReDI school.
I would like help on my classes and/or career development.
I would like to get guidance from an expert from the digital industry.
I can make time to meet with a mentor on a regular basis.
I am open to get feedback on the topics I disscuss with my mentor.

carousel.headlineMentorOrMentee: What others say about our mentorship

quoteKhaled.title: Anna, mentee and almumna of RedI School
quoteKhaled.text: A friend in React, my course, made me sign up for the mentoring program, this is how I met Khaled. He was my mentor for a year. (so grateful to her and to Khaled!) ... last year I started an internship and I now work as a frontend developer.

quoteHalil.title: Halil Esmer, student of the Digital Career Program, Berlin
quoteHalil.text: I joined the mentorship program in 2019. My mentor gave me important incentives how I can start a career in IT. He showed me how a recruiter would look at my application and how to create specific applications for each position I apply for.

quoteDragos.title: Dragos Nedelcu, Mentor at RedI School & Software Developer
quoteDragos.text: I first came in touch with mentoring as a mentee. It was not until I joined the Mentorship Program at RedI School in Berlin that I became a mentor myself. I believe mentoring is crucial and critical to individual and organizational success.
